ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great mix of practical applications and theoretical foundations

Excellent course for understanding strategic thinking regarding global health. Projects reinforced the core instruction of creating clear objectives, goals, and strategies. The mock presentations of development projects highlighted the necessity of clear and concise information relevant to the particular intervention. These skills will be valuable for anyone working in this or related fields.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Very responsive to students' commentsHas a great background with helpful experience in the fieldCould ask for more critical thinking

Instructor: Elizabeth Howe Bradley  Excellent instructor for this material. She's knowledgeable and well experienced in the field. In the didactic part of the course, Doctor Bradley provided a wealth of information regarding strategic interventions; their successes and failures. In the second part of the course with our presentations, she provided excellent criticisms to help hone each project team's work. Overall outstanding.
Instructor: Leslie Curry  Did not lecture to class.
Instructor: Michael Skonieczny  Limited instruction in class. Provided one lecture and participated in panel. Very good in lecture, and in salient points made during presentation projects.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Excellent course, particularly for those interested in working in the field of global health funding and development. Student team project requires significant investment in research and is an exercise in team dynamics, but ultimately outcome is extremely practical and educationally valuable. Very relevant to public health.
